core:description.@value:
In the Design Centre, when you use custom authentication and the mocking service, you will see:

1   Authorization method
<Method Name> 
 
2   Set authorization data"
 
The authorization data may be already filled out, however the error:
"Fill in required parameters"
 
remains. If you fill in at least one field, the error disappears, however the request still cannot be sent. All Authorization fields must be re-typed before you can submit the request

Steps to reproduce

Create a new API Specification
Import the attached File
Run the Mocking Service for api.xml
Click "Authorize and Send"
– This fails

Re-type the Client ID and Client Secret

Click "Authorize and Send"
– This works

Workaround
Re-type in the values and everything works!
A successful API status check.
This security scheme authenticates the source of an API call by requiring the calling application to provide credentials, in the form of a Client ID and Client Secret, in the request headers.
A valid Client ID that uniquely identifies the consuming application
A valid Client ID that uniquely identifies the consuming application
A secret key, known only to the consuming application, which can be used to verify its identity
A secret key, known only to the consuming application, which can be used to verify its identity
Test query parameter
Test query parameter
